instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1369: What is A1369? A1369 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Late 2010, Mid 2011 with EMC 2392, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2838, 820-3023..
definitions.820-3023: What is 820-3023? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
Hi,

I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A the beeps 3 times.
The only thing strange that i notice on the board is the <TRANSISTOR>Q9425</TRANSISTOR> with some strange colour (like a bit burnt).
I get 1.5V on = <SIGNAL>PP1V5_S3_MEM_B</SIGNAL>
I suppose that it is related to the RAM, but i have now idea for where to start.
Can you please help?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message: I reballed all 16 chips one time and board still works after 6 months.
